channel.description: Recent content in Posts on MISSS Blog

item.title: Grouped Fixed Effects
item.description: Grouped Patterns of Heterogeneity in Panel Data (with Elena Manresa) Econometrica, 83(3), 1147-1184, May 2015. Summary: This post basically summarizes the grouped panel data model, which allows time-varying grouped patterns of unobservable heterogeneity in linear panel data models (Bonhomme and Manresa 2015). Model Specification The linear model with grouped patterns of heterogeneity: $$ y_{it} = x'_{it}\theta + \alpha_{g_{i}t}+v_{it},\quad\quad i = 1,…,N,\quad t = 1,…,T, $$ where ​ $x_{ij}$: covariates, $E[v_{ij}|x_{ij}]=0$

item.title: My 1st post
item.description: This is an equation: $$y_{it} = x'_{it}\theta + \alpha_{g_{i}t}+v_{it},\quad\quad i = 1,…,N,\quad t = 1,…,T,$$ This is a variable: $x_{it}$

Reading List March 2021 Methodology Bonhomme, Stéphane, and Elena Manresa. “Grouped Patterns of Heterogeneity in Panel Data.” Econometrica 83.3 (2015): 1147-1184. Bonhomme, Stéphane. Teams: Heterogeneity, Sorting, and Complementarity. Working Paper. Bonhomme, Stéphane, Thibaut Lamadon, and Elena Manresa. “A distributional framework for matched employer employee data.” Econometrica 87.3 (2019): 699-739. Bonhomme, Stéphane. “Econometric analysis of bipartite networks” The Econometric Analysis of Network Data. Academic Press, 2020. 83-121. Arellano, Manuel, and Stéphane Bonhomme.

Team Heterogeneity 2021/03/10 Teams: Heterogeneity, Sorting, and Complementarity Keywords: Networks, production, complementarity, sorting. Summary: How much do individuals contribute to team output? I propose an econometric framework to quantify individual contributions when only the output of their teams is observed. Useful Resources Slides of the presentation at the 2020 World Congress of the Econometric Society. Slides and video of the presentation at the Chamberlain Seminar. Codes to estimate additive and nonlinear models of team production
